property.name: text
property.value: State codes: 0 Listening L; 1 Master M; 2 Slave S; 3 Passive P BMC parameters: priority (priority1), class (clockClass), variance (stand-in for accuracy, variance, prioiry2), identity.

property.name: text
property.value: Datasets: default: priority, class, variance, identity current: stepsRemoved parent: parentIdentity, parentPort, gmPriority, gmClass, gmVariance, gmIdentity port: portState

property.name: D0vector
property.value: {255, identity, 0, wpriority, wclass, wvariance, identity, 0, identity, 0, 0, 0}

property.name: text
text
property.value:
Clauses 9.2.6.8, 9.3.2.3, 9.5.1, and 9.6 require that: 1-Updates to port state and data sets be atomic and 2-Computation of erbest and ebest needed for this be included in the same atomic process.
This implies that 1: The processMessages and processAI (AI is state change event) each be atomic 2: The processAI (state change event) includes the following actors: updateWindowsSlotCount, computeERBEST, recommendedState, updateDataSetsAndState updateParentDataSets and associated actors 3: An announce receipt timeout (art event) also triggers the actors: updateDataSetsAndState updateParentDataSets and associated actors and this process must be atomic 4: Message inputs, AI (state change event), and art are all asynchronous
To do this: 1- processMessages, processAI and art each generate distinct completion events 2- The stateChangeEventManagement actor ensures that these processes are atomic and that other process inputs during an atomic process are not lost.

property.name: text
property.value: These updates are used to modify wpriority, wclass, or wvariance at run time

property.name: text
property.value:
-updateDataSetCode is the input to the clock level actor that updates the parent and current datasets. portState is portVariable. {6,portNum} = listening state, no updates portState =0 {0,portNum} = update to D0 (M1 or M2 fig 26), portState = 1 master {1,portNum} = update to ebest by slave port (S1 of fig 26), portState = 2 slave (3,portNum} = no dataset update (P1 or P2 fig 26), portState = 3 passive (3,portNum} = 9.2.6.11 qualified (M3 of fig 26) , no dataset update portState = 1 master or 4 pre-master
RECOMMENDED state codes: 0=M1, 1=P1, 2=M2, 3=S1, 4=P2, 5=M3, 6=Listening 255=error

property.name: text
property.value: tempPortState: 0 => listening 1 => master 2 => slave 3 => passive 4 => pre-master 5 => uncalibrated

property.name: text
property.value:
Tables 13 and 16 for parent and current datasets per Figure 26 and 9.2.6.11 for announceReceiptTimeoutEvent
Note that the order of these is non-deterministic but irrelevant. For example any update to a master state is held pending other ports to see if a slave update is requested which takes precedence. An update due to an announce timeout is always unique and not accompanied by others and can be made upon receipt. (this is guaranteed by the stateChangeEventManagementActor)
From Figure 26: IF ANY port indicates M1 then all port must be either M1 or P1 IF ANY port indicates M2 then all port must be M2 ELSE there must be EITHER: 1-a SINGLE port in S1 and all others in either M3 or P2 2-all ports are in the Listening state
THEREFORE for normal, i.e. not announce receipt timeout If countM1M2 >0, slaveCount == 0, hence update D0, or If slaveCount == 1, countM1M2 == 0, hence updateS1, or If slaveCount == 0, countM1M2 ==0, listenCount ==4 hence no update due to listening ELSE an error has occured

property.name: text
property.value: -portState output updates portState variable in port dataset -displayState output updates text in the port's position in the clockActor icon -updateDataSetCode is the input to the clock level actor that updates the parent and current datasets. portState is portVariable. {6,PortNum} = Listening state, no updates, portState =0 {0,portNum} = update to D0 (M1 or M2 fig 26), portState = 1 master {1,portNum} = update to ebest by slave port (S1 of fig 26), portState = 2 slave (3,portNum} = no dataset update (P1 or P2 fig 26), portState = 3 passive (3,portNum} = 9.2.6.11 qualified (M3 of fig 26) , no dataset update portState = 1 master or 4 pre-master When due to announce receipt timeout (M1 or M3 9.2.6.11) it is handled at clock level RECOMMENDED state codes: 0=M1, 1=P1, 2=M2, 3=S1, 4=P2, 5=M3, 6= Listening 255=error

property.name: annotation
property.value: T2 M1 or M2 of Fig 26

property.name: annotation
property.value: T8 M1 or M2 of Fig 26

property.name: annotation
property.value: T11 less than 4 ports have responded

property.name: annotation
property.value: T14 updateCode ==0 M1 or M2 Fig 26 update D0

property.name: text
text
property.value:
If any port is in the S (slave) state then the clock is NOT a grandmaster. If no port is in the S (slave) state the clock is a grandmaster provided all states are NOT Listening.
Grandmasters clocks appear with a light green fill Non-GM clocks appear with a white fill

entity.name: StringConst
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringConst2
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

property.name: text
property.value:
This actor initializes the Default DB as follows: sets _priority and wpriority to the value of priority sets _class and wclass to the value of class sets _variance and wvariance to the value of variance
priority, class and variance are RESET parameters of the clock. This actor copies these into the update values _priority, _class and _variance and the working values wpriority, wclass and wvariance. Thus on a re-run or resume the initial values of the parameters are reinstated (they may be modified by setVariable ports as part of the simulation).
IF useConfiguredState is true then: update values of wpriority and _priority to 0 and wclass and _class to 3

property.name: text
property.value: -updateDataSetCode is the input to the clock level actor that updates the parent and current datasets. portState is portVariable. listening state, no updates (not implemented), portState =0 {0,portNum} = update to D0 (M1 or M2 fig 26), portState = 1 master {1,portNum} = update to ebest by slave port (S1 of fig 26), portState = 2 slave (3,portNum} = no dataset update (P1 or P2 fig 26), portState = 3 passive (5,portNum} = 9.2.6.11 qualified (M3 of fig 26) , no dataset update portState = 1 master or 4 pre-master {2,portNum} = when due to announce receipt timeout (M1 or M3 9.2.6.11) RECOMMENDED state codes: 0=M1, 1=P1, 2=M2, 3=S1, 4=P2, 5=M3, 255=error

property.name: text
property.value:
9.2.6.11 For a boundary clock with no other port in the SLAVE state, update the port�s data sets to the MASTER state configuration (see 9.3.5), as specified for decision M1.
If an 9-2-6-11 port event = TRUE is received it is always from a port in the SLAVE state when the ART occured.

property.name: text
property.value:
9.2.6.11 For a boundary clock with no other port in the SLAVE state, update the port�s data sets to the MASTER state configuration (see 9.3.5), as specified for decision M1.
If an 9-2-6-11 port event = TRUE is received it is always from a port in the SLAVE state when the ART occured.

property.name: text
property.value:
9.2.6.11 For a boundary clock with no other port in the SLAVE state, update the port�s data sets to the MASTER state configuration (see 9.3.5), as specified for decision M1.
If an 9-2-6-11 port event = TRUE is received it is always from a port in the SLAVE state when the ART occured.
the portSlave inputs are true iff the corresponding port is in the Slave state

entity.name: StringConst
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

property.name: text
property.value: When requests have been received from all 4 ports the updates of wpriority, wclass, and wvariance are made from the update set _priority, _class, and _variance. Then the complete signal is generated which also clears the accumulator for the next cycle.

property.name: text
property.value:
This actor initializes the Default DB as follows: sets _priority and wpriority to the value of priority sets _class and wclass to the value of class sets _variance and wvariance to the value of variance
priority, class and variance are RESET parameters of the clock. This actor copies these into the update values _priority, _class and _variance and the working values wpriority, wclass and wvariance. Thus on a re-run or resume the initial values of the parameters are reinstated (they may be modified by setVariable ports as part of the simulation).
IF useConfiguredState is true then: update values of wpriority and _priority to 0 and wclass and _class to 3

property.name: text
property.value: 9523correction: =true implies that this port is receiving msgs from another port on the same clock and should be placed in the passive state =false implies that either such messages are NOT being received OR that this is the port with the lowest port number receiving such messages

property.name: text
property.value: true implies that msg received on this port from a lower numbered port on same clock false implies that no more mmsg received in 2 AI
